name: GDG DEVFEST NAIROBI &CENTRAL
description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Joining thousands all over the world for the greatest series of DevFest events DevFest Nairobi and Central Google Developer Groups are coming together to have the biggest developer event of the year! aimed at familiarizing attendees (who are members of a variety of developer communities) with groundbreaking technology advancements. We will be working closely with Women Techmakers in this devfest season, to continue improving the diversity in our ecosystem.

name: Google Cloud Study Jam 2018

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

description:
• What we'll do
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.
Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

• What to bring
Bring your laptop -- Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.
Bring your laptop charger.

The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Create a Qwiklabs account at https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up. Make sure you check the opt-in box for promos! That makes you eligible for additional free access after you complete the first series of labs.

• Important to know
Come and learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. And Many more.... Looking forward to see you.

name: Hash Code 2018

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

description:
• What we'll do
Hash Code 2018

Hash Code is a team programming competition organized by Google. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a Google engineering problem for you to solve.
Are you up for the challenge?

You are required to register this Hub through the official website:
https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/

Stay tuned for more information.

GDG UoN is organizing a HUB where you can join with your team.

| Registration |

It is now possible to register your team for the HashCode 2018!
https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/signup.html
You need to register at the website and pick our hub to be able to attend this space. Don't stay at home, come solve with us!

More info coming up soon :

• What to bring
Laptop

• Important to know

name: Progressive Web Apps For Beginners.

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

description:
What to expect

Join us for presentations & conversations from experts using and shaping this technologies, as well as hands on coding sessions with developers.

• What to bring
Laptop and charger.
Psych to learn and meet new people.

• Important to know

Kindly keep time as it is going to be a 2hour codelab.

name: Workshop - Introduction to Firebase

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

description: Join us in learning what firebase is, the awesome features it has to offer and how to use Firebase Auth and Cloud Firestore for Android
how_to_find_us: Master's Lab, School of Computing and Informatics

name: Machine Learning with Azure - Workshop

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

description:
Come and learn how to build and deploy machine learning solutions to the cloud.
Bring a laptop, a notebook, and enthusiasm.
Food & Snacks will be served at the venue to members who RSVP'd only.

name: Google Digital Skills Training

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

description:
Come and learn new skills for a digital world. Learn how to grow your career at your own pace, with flexible and personalized training courses designed to build your confidence and help you thrive.
The session will run from 1 PM to 4 PM.
Come with your laptop, notebook, and an enthusiastic attitude.

name: Machine Learning - Computer vision + Bot services

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

description:
For Bot services, assemble, interface, convey and oversee keen bots to connect normally with your clients on sites, applications, Facebook Messenger and much more.
Extract rich information from images to categorize and process visual data—and perform machine-assisted moderation of images to help curate your services using computer visions.

name: Google Cloud Study Jam - Essentials

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through 4 Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the cloud console, Kubernetes and Machine Learning.
Then after the meetup, you will have free access to 3 more labs you can finish at home. Complete all 7 labs and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile.
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Please share your excitement using the hashtag #CloudStudyJam19
how_to_find_us: Please make sure to carry your student ID (UoN students) or your national ID/passport. The venue is at the College of Biological and Physical Sciences; Chiromo campus. At the gate, ask for directions to SCI or C4D Lab.
